docs.lead_paragraph: ''Let me sell 50 million, then I'll call it quits.'' Five years ago, Bubba Sparxxx unveiled his career plan. He was a white rapper from La Grange, Ga., who suddenly -- which is to say, finally -- found himself headed toward the pop charts. After years of hustling he had acquired the one thing every aspiring hip-hop star wants: a big-name mentor.
docs.abstract: Kelefa Sanneh reviews new CD by rapper Bubba Sparxxx; photo (M)
docs.snippet: Five years ago Bubba Sparxxx wanted to sell 50 million records and then quit. Now he's getting used to the idea that he may never be able to do either.

docs.lead_paragraph: I learned only recently that my husband was nursing the antiquated notion that a belt is something you put through loops. I realize that some couples, after nearly 18 years of marriage, might have covered this topic along with the other big ones like religion and whether it's acceptable to stop at an inauthentic Mexican restaurant on a road trip if the only other choice is fast food.

headline.main: A Big Belt Plays the Bully in My Closet

docs.abstract: Michelle Slatalla Online Shopper column on big belts; drawing (M)
docs.snippet: Braided and embroidered, big belts may sport more grommets than a construction site. But what do you do with them?

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Don't Take This Lying Down,'' by Sarah Bilston (Op-Ed, March 24): My obstetrician prescribed 10 weeks of bed rest when I went into premature labor with my (now healthy) twins. She directed me to keep my body still, but not my mind. And I can't imagine that Ms. Bilston's doctor did either.

headline.main: How to Rest When You're Expecting

docs.abstract: Erin E Foster letter, prompted by Sarah Bilston March 24 Op-Ed describing her bed rest experience when pregnant, says there are many ways to keep mentally active while on bed rest
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''Don't Take This Lying Down,'' by Sarah Bilston (Op-Ed, March 24):     My obstetrician prescribed 10 weeks of bed rest when I went into premature labor with my (now healthy) twins. She directed me to keep my body still, but not...

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Sarah Bilston bases her opinion about bed rest for pregnant women on one anecdotal experience -- her own pregnancy.

headline.main: How to Rest When You're Expecting

docs.abstract: Dr Jessica R Jacob letter says instead of complaining about boredom of bed rest, Sarah Bilston (March 24 Op-Ed) should be thankful that bed rest gave her opportunity to protect her baby; drawing
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Sarah Bilston bases her opinion about bed rest for pregnant women on one anecdotal experience -- her own pregnancy.
